means: （用作单或复）（古罗马的）农神节(12月17日起持续七天)
纵情狂欢，恣意放浪（的场面）

sentence.Network_en: The Romans called this celebration Saturnalia, in honor of their god Saturn.
sentence.Network_cn: 古罗马人称其为农神节, 为了纪念他们的神“萨杜恩”.

PerfectNetExp.abs: GRE逆序_馆档网 ... branchia 鳃 saturnalia 纵情狂欢 penetralia 最深处，秘藏.

means.word_mean: 1. a wild gathering involving excessive drinking and promiscuity

auth_sentence.content: Saturnalia is never less than music on a grand scale.
auth_sentence.res_content: Saturnalia is never less than music on a grand scale.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Saturnalia is never less than music on a grand scale.

auth_sentence.content: Even in the murky feel to Saturnalia, there is a variety in the sounds and influences.
auth_sentence.res_content: Even in the murky feel to Saturnalia, there is a variety in the sounds and influences.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Even in the murky feel to Saturnalia, there is a variety in the sounds and influences.

auth_sentence.content: These included covering houses in greenery and bawdy partying that had its roots in the unruly festival of Saturnalia.
